definition: to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey

sentences.english: Several wolves were rending a lamb to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 几条狼正在把一只羊撕扯成碎块。

sentences.english: How I loved the man, as I teared off his clothes.
sentences.chinese: 我是如此爱这男人，当我撕扯他的衣裳。

sentences.english: It has a very high tear strength, high abrasion resistance and is extremely resistant to oils and greases .
sentences.chinese: 它有着高撕扯性，高耐磨性，及非常好的抗油性。

sentences.english: The hedge shook as he tangled with the hound.
sentences.chinese: 它和猎浣熊犬撕扯时，树篱晃个不停。

sentences.english: The wind tore at the newly planted sapling .
sentences.chinese: 风猛列地撕扯着栽的树苗。

sentences.english: Then he begins wildly tearing the shirt apart, creating strips of cloth.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他开始疯狂地将衣服撕扯成一条条的布料。

sentences.english: Take care when you put on the condom so that you do not tear it.
sentences.chinese: 你要当心，在戴上避孕套时不要撕扯。

sentences.english: The irritation of his burns was so tense that the patient dept tearing at the bandages.
sentences.chinese: 病人的烧伤处痛疼难忍，使他不停地撕扯着绷带。

sentences.english: or tearing a comb through your gold-wet hair.
sentences.chinese: 或者用梳子撕扯着你湿湿的金发。

sentences.english: The meat is then eaten by hand, with diners grabbing and pulling pieces of the meat off the bone.
sentences.chinese: 之后应该有手抓羊肉，将肉撕扯着吃，直至看见骨头。

sentences.english: The wind tore at the newly planted sapling.
sentences.chinese: 风猛列地撕扯着栽的树苗。

definition: to tear at (with the teeth, like one animal attacking another)
to drag/to pull/to raise a child (through difficulties)/to help/to support/to drag in/to chat
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
to fight together/to come to blows
